fields.description:
*Summary:*

Currently, when you upload an image via the *insert image* in the comment function, it shows you only the *recent uploads* and not all images for the specific ticket.

*Suggestion:*

Include all images uploaded for the current ticket.
fields.summary: Include all images for current ticket.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding an image to a comment on the new issue view, the image preview is sent on the notification email. However, those images are broken in the email notification

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using the new issue view, add an image to a comment on an issue;
 # Check the notification email received by the comment added event.

h3. Expected Results

The image will be present in the notification email and visible. 

h3. Actual Results

The image is broken on the email notification
* !image broken.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

A workaround will be to use the "old" view to add images on comments.
fields.summary: Inline images are broken in the email notification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to to create an issue if the description contains user mention wiki-markup with the '$' character.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the issue creation form
 # In the ticket description add the follow text (wiki-markup for user mention)

{code:java}
[$CURRENT_USER_NAME|~accountid:$CURRENT_USER_ACCOUNT_ID]{code}

 # Create the ticket

h3. Expected Results

Ticket is created successfully
h3. Actual Results

A 500 is returned from the server.
h3. Workaround

Change the format of the description text so it doesn't match the user mention format. But this will mean the markup isn't valid anymore.
fields.summary: Creating a new issue with user mention wiki-markup from the global issue create dialog throws a 500 error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the personal profile page in Jira, there is a section "Worked on" which shows the latest tickets worked by the user. If a new issue is created it will have a description like "projectname: you updated this today" or "projectname: you created this today" along with the issue number.

This is not working for the "Time Tracking" field.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a story in a Jira Software project.(Screenshot1.png)
 # Go to the "Worked on" section under the personal profile page in Jira.  It shows the story that has been created today.(Screenshot2.png)
 # Update the Time tracking field in the story. This will not get reflected in the "Worked on" section.(Screenshot3.png, Screenshot4.png)
 # Update any other field in the story like assigned to, comments, priority, estimate, etc. This will get reflected in the "Worked on" section.(Screenshot5.png,Screenshot6.png)

h3. Expected Results

Irrespective of the field which gets updated for an issue, it should reflect in the "Worked on" section of My profile page.
h3. Actual Results

In case the time tracking field is updated in the ticket, this is not getting reflected in the "Worked on" section of My profile page.
h3. Workaround

No workaround is available.
fields.summary: Changes in Time tracking field is not reflected in Personal profile page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attempting to search for issues using the JQL {{updatedDate >= '2019-03-10 02:56'}} produces an error indicating the date format is invalid. Changing the date or time to anything outside of 2019-03-10 02:00 through 2019-03-10 02:59 successfully returns results.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform an advanced search using this JQL in a Jira Cloud site: {{updatedDate >= '2019-03-10 02:56'}} or here: [https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=updatedDate%20%3E%3D%20%272019-03-10%2002%3A56%27]

h3. Expected Results

The search parses the date successfully and returns results.
h3. Actual Results

An error is returned indicating the date format isn't valid even though it is.
{quote}Date value '2019-03-10 02:56' for field 'updatedDate' is invalid. Valid formats include: 'yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm', 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm', 'yyyy/MM/dd', 'yyyy-MM-dd', or a period format e.g. '-5d', '4w 2d'.
{quote}
01:59 on that date works: [https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=updatedDate%20%3E%3D%20%272019-03-10%2001%3A59%27]
 03:00 on that date also works: [https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=updatedDate%20%3E%3D%20%272019-03-10%2003%3A00%27]
 Anything in the 02:XX hour on that specific date fails to parse.

The following messages are shown in the Jira logs:
{code:java}
2020-05-15 20:11:12.670	INFO	com.atlassian.jira.datetime.JodaDateTimeFormatter	Pattern "dd/MMM/yy h:mm a" is unable to parse "2019-03-10 02:56": Invalid format: "2019-03-10 02:56" is malformed at "19-03-10 02:56"	 2020-05-15 20:11:12.670	INFO	com.atlassian.jira.datetime.JodaDateTimeFormatter	Pattern "d/MMM/yy" is unable to parse "2019-03-10 02:56": Invalid format: "2019-03-10 02:56" is malformed at "19-03-10 02:56"	 	 
2020-05-15 20:11:12.100	INFO	com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.transformer.DateSearchInputTransformer.privacy-safe	Unable to parse date '2019-03-10 02:56'.{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue navigator fails to parse specific date time

fields.description: The modals when creating a new issue/viewing an issue often can hide relevant info for inputting in the current action. This tends to lead to opening a new window & losing the benefit of having a modal - consider making these draggable.
fields.summary: Draggable modals

fields.description:

When using the new navigation, if you click the search option and click "Issues", "Boards", etc. you see an error in the console logs and you aren't redirected to the feature.

For example, if you try to go to the advanced search, you cannot access it as the button doesn't work.

 # Click the search field
 # Click *Issues* at the bottom of the panel

h3. Expected Results

You're redirected to the Jira search
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens and the following error can be seen in the browser console:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When quick creating sub-tasks in the New Issue View, the modal does not respect the selected issue type from the quick creation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two-issue sub-task issue types in your project;
# Set a required field for both of them in the Field Configuration to enforce the pop-up screen;
# Create a sub-task by selecting each issue type.

h3. Expected Results

The selected issue type in the quick creation will reflect in the create screen that pops-up.

h3. Actual Results

The same issue type will be selected on the screen pop-up, independent of the one that is selected in the quick creation.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When quick creating sub-tasks in the New Issue View, the modal does not respect the selected issue type

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 16 June 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Admins can now access a _Find your field_ option in the three dot menu from the new issue view. For more details on how this works, please see our documentation [here|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/find-a-field-on-the-issue-view/]. 

In order to not overcrowd the three dot menu, we will keep the Notification Helper and Permission Helper accessible via _Settings > System or via the dot dialog (accessible by pressing the period key / ".")

Thanks

Tha Atlassian Cloud team
{panel}
It would be nice to have the 'Admin' button in New issue view , which was present in Old issue view. 
 This would help the admins to verify Permission, Notification and field settings without navigating out of Issue view. 
 Currently _Permission helper_ and _Notification helper_ are moved to Settings page . However , there is no workaround for _"Where is my field",_ apart from switching to old issue view.
fields.summary: Add 'Admin' button in New issue view, which has Permission helper, Notification helper and Where is my field.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Running a rule to edit the request participants field with the trigger of issue created will overwrite the existing request participants added by email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* 1. Create a rule with the existing configurations:
* When: Issue is created
* Edit issue > request participants > copy from issue + other users.
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-14 at 16.34.07.png|thumbnail! 
* 2. Send an email, adding a CC on it to add as request participant.

h3. Expected Results
Automation for Jira will append the users from the rule with the user added from the incoming email.
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-14 at 16.35.28.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Automation for Jira overwrite the field and only add those from the rule, removing the users added from the incoming email.
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-14 at 16.36.34.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The same doesn't happen to transition issue trigger.

h3. Workaround
Add a "Re-fetch issue data" action before the edit issue.
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-12 at 16.26.46.png|thumbnail! 

This will make the first CC to be appended to the ones in the rule:
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-12 at 16.26.54.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Editing issue while the issue is created to add request participants will overwrite existing values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is great that Jira Admins can create Rules, however, the rules are by default configured as Global Rules, it is better if the field is empty and forces users to enter the project to preventing creating Global Rules.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Automation Rule page
 # Create a new Rule
 # Jira jumps directly to the Rule Diagram and the RUle is configured as Global

h3. Expected Results

Jira should first show the Rule Configuration page and let the Project Field empty, ready to be specify by the user. 
h3. Actual Results

The rule is Global and Jira jumps to the rule Diagram
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Improve the Automation Rule Setup

fields.description:
At this time Jira Webhooks do have a [Retry policy|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/webhooks/#retry-policy] but this does not apply to Automation ones. 

Sometimes users want to customize the payload or even need to provide custom headers and to do so, they use automation rules and it would be nice to have a retry policy applied to automation rules as well.
fields.summary: Add Webhook retry policy for Automation rules

It is troublesome to manually delete screen schemes that are not associated to any project one by one especially if you have a huge instance that has a lot of screen schemes.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When changed Account preferences to Polski, the field *Start Date* is not translated to Polski
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change your preferred language from English to Polski
 # Create an issue with a *Start Date* 

h3. Expected Results

Start date is translated to Polski
h3. Actual Results

Start Date is not translated to Polski and remains in English.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Start Date not translated to Polski

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a subtask is created using the *Create Sub-task* button, in the new issue view, the option to *Link Confluence Page* doesn't appear. Upon refreshing the page, the button reappears.
 This is *NOT* reproducible in the following scenarios:
 * relatively old projects.
 * when the + sign is used to create subtask instead of the *Create Sub-task* button.
 * When the sub-task is created in the board view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new software project with Kanban template.
 # Create an issue in that.
 # Go to the issue view screen.
 # Create a subtask using the *Create Sub-task* button.
 # Open the newly created subtask.
 # Click the dropdown beside *Link Issue*.

h3. Expected Results
 * Two links, *Link confluence page* and *Add Web link* should appear.
  !Screenshot 2020-05-13 at 3.49.32 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
 * Only one option, *Add Web link* appears.
 !Screenshot 2020-05-13 at 3.32.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

 * Refreshing the page OR reopening the subtask fixes this problem.
fields.summary: Option to link confluence page doesn't appear in new issue view in sub-tasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Pasting a link with an email in it into a URL field creates a mailto: link

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a URL custom field and add it to an issue screen
 # Paste a URL with an email into the field (e.g. https://example.com/?query=email:foo@bar.com%20OR%20123)

h3. Expected Results
Clicking the link takes you to the URL

h3. Actual Results
Clicking the link takes you to an email client because the link is interpreted as an email and transformed to a mailto:

h3. Workaround
No known workaround, currently
fields.summary: Pasting a link with an email in it into a URL field creates a mailto: link

fields.description: As a user, I would like to be able to set Project Roles in Global Permissions. The reason for that is because I would like to allow only users in the Project Role administrators to perform some application-wide actions.
fields.summary: Allow Project Roles to be added to Global Permissions

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Currently, in next-gen projects, if you have an issue that has sub-tasks and when completing/closing the last child issue, and the parent issue isn't completed yet, we don't have a pop-up displayed so we can update parent issue status, as is available in classic projects.

h3. Why is it important?
This would facilitate the customer's work and would benefit time and effort from the client's part.

h3. Suggested resolution
Currently, we don't have any other possibilities unless moving it manually to Done/Complete/Closed status.
fields.summary: Update parent issue status pop-up in Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Text copied from OneNote is added as an attachment if you are using the old issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure your issue to use the old issue view
 # Copy a piece of text from OneNote and paste it in a new comment and it prompts to save it as a screenshot instead of text.
 # I have only been able to reproduce it for *Windows* laptop only, for the browsers – Chrome Version 81.0.4044.138 and Firefox Version 76.0.1.
 ## When editing an *existing* comment however, the text is added as expected.
 ## The issue is not reproduced on a macOS system however.

h3. Expected Results

Comment should be added as a text only.
h3. Actual Results

Jira prompts instead to add it as a screenshot instead.
h3. Workaround

Please consider using the New issue view.
fields.summary: Copying text from OneNote into a new issue comment adds it as an attachment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a user's language is set to English, the decimal separator for time tracking fields should be the dot (.).
Example: Original estimate = 3.5d -> The issue gets created with an original estimate of three days and a half

If the user uses comma (,) instead of dot (.), Jira simply ignores the comma character:
Example: Original estimate = 3,5d -> Issue gets created with 35 (thirty-five) days of original estimate.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue
 # In the _Create issue_ screen, put the original estimate as "3,5d" (three comma five)

h3. Expected Results
An error should be thrown, as the decimal separator is wrong. 
This is the case when using ; as decimal separator
This is also the case when the user's language is French (where the decimal separator is the comma, ) but the user uses the dot (.).

h3. Actual Results
Instead of throwing an error, Jira completely ignores the character and creates the issue with an original estimate 10 times larger.

This is also valid for issues created with REST API calls.


h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Comma (,) as decimal separator is ignored in time estimation fields

fields.description:
Currently, we are supporting only IMAP and POP protocol however there are companies email service provider does not allow us to use POP/IMAP for external use.

Hence another mechanism or any alternative around the same would help.
fields.summary: Support mail server other than POP/IMAP

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to make the attachment field as required though Field configuration. Its only possible to make it required through Workflow validators. 
 However , due to this feature request https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30636 ( which is closed as Wont do) , currently fields marked as required in "Validators" do not show the red asterisk sign. 
 Users are shown the error message only after filling all the details. 
 Please consider making Attachment field as required from Field configuration.
fields.summary: Add the ability to make Attachment field as Required through Field configuration.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Summary

No popup dialogue on the new issue view, when clicking on Reviews tab under the Developement Panel section.
h3. Steps to replicate
 # Integrate Crucible with Jira
 # Create an issue with Crucible
 # View issue

h3. Expected Result

Review dialogue pops up.
h3. Actual Result

Nothing happens when clicking on Review
h3. Workaround

Disable old issue editor [What is the new Jira issue view? - Jira Core Cloud - Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/what-is-the-new-jira-issue-view#Can-I-turn-the-new-Jira-issue-view-on-or-off]
{quote}
h3. Can I turn the new Jira issue view on or off?

You can toggle the new view on or off for classic projects in Jira Software for now. The new issue view is permanently on for all [business boards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/working-with-boards-800712866.html] and [next-gen software projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/working-with-next-gen-software-projects-945104895.html], so you can’t turn it off for those.

To turn the new issue view on or off in Jira Software and Jira Core for now:
 # Select *Your profile and settings* () > *Personal settings*.

 # Toggle the switch for the _New Jira issue view_.

If you don't see the *Personal settings* option when you click your avatar, the switch to turn the new issue view on or off will appear under *Profile*.
h3. Can I temporarily click through to the old issue view?

You can temporarily _click through_ to the old issue view on issues in classic projects. This can be If you need to complete a task not supported in the new view yet,
 # If you’re not viewing the full-page version of the issue, click the issue key to open it in full page.

 # Choose > *See the old view*.

The old issue view will open for you to complete your tasks. Next time you view an issue, you’ll see the new issue view again.
{quote}
fields.summary: Reviews tab on Developement Panel isn't opening in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Currently, a margin of 1.143rem is added to paragraphs
* This causes spacing to look too wide if there is a non-breaking space(nbsp) or spacing appears to be wider than expected 
 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow admins to toggle/adjust the margin settings

h3. Why this is important
* Spacing of text is awkward
* Affects readability of text within fields and comments
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Margins added to paragraphs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Status field dropdown is not in the right position.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue/epic with child issues/subtasks
 # Click on the status to open the transition dropdown
 # The dropdown has moved to the top left corner.
 # As a workaround, you can make the transition in the dropdown in that position.
But will need to refresh the page to get the dropdown working again.

h3. Expected Results

The dropdown should appear below the button and should work everytime.
h3. Actual Results

The dropdown appears at the top left corner. Doesn't work on the second try.
h3. Workaround

The dropdown options are still usable even if position has changed after a refresh
 Turning on [https://app.launchdarkly.com/jira/production/features/issue-details.item-card-keyboard-accessible/targeting].
fields.summary: Status field dropdown is not in the right position.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have multiple issues as children of an Epic (3 hundred for example), when you click the "View in Search" option you face an HTTP Status 400 – Bad Request error page with a stack trace.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Software project
# Create an Epic
# Create 400 issues and make them children of the Epic created above
# Access the Epic and next to *Issues in this epic* click *more > View in search*

h3. Expected Results

The children of the Epic are displayed in the search view

h3. Actual Results

A page showing an HTTP Status 400 – Bad Request error with the following stack trace is displayed:

{code}
Type Exception Report

Message Request header is too large

Description The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Exception

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Request header is too large
	org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11InputBuffer.fill(Http11InputBuffer.java:722)
	org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11InputBuffer.parseHeader(Http11InputBuffer.java:884)
	org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11InputBuffer.parseHeaders(Http11InputBuffer.java:565)
	org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.service(Http11Processor.java:277)
	org.apache.coyote.AbstractProcessorLight.process(AbstractProcessorLight.java:65)
	org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol$ConnectionHandler.process(AbstractProtocol.java:868)
	org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.doRun(NioEndpoint.java:1639)
	org.apache.tomcat.util.net.SocketProcessorBase.run(SocketProcessorBase.java:49)
	java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Note The full stack trace of the root cause is available in the server logs.
{code}

h3. Notes

This bug is caused by another bug, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71755. When clicking on "View in search", the JQL search should be {{"Epic Link" = JRA-1234}} instead of searching by the key of each one of the children story

h3. Workaround

Go to the search page and use the following JQL (replace JRA-1234 by the issue key of the Epic):

{code}"Epic Link" = JRA-1234{code}
fields.summary: A large number of issues in an Epic breaks the "View in Search" function

fields.description:
h4. Problem definition
When trying to perform a CSV import, the user cannot select which Project Template and Type are being created. The current documentation [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/importing-data-from-csv-881683854.html] does not include the information for importing the Project Type.

h4. Suggested solution
Update the documentation to reflect this by explaining that the "Project Type" column should be added with the possible values  as "Software, Business, and service_desk"

h4. Possible Workaround
If a user would like to create a project while importing issues from a CSV file, what is possible to accomplish is while importing, when selecting the project, we can create a new one and specify its type and template.
fields.summary: CSV Import should include information regarding Project Type and Template.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a Field Required Validator to a workflow, the Available Field box gets stretched to the right when there is a custom field with a long name. This forces the user to scroll the page to see the rest of it.

h3.Steps to reproduce
# Go to custom fields and create a new field having a very big name.
# Choose a workflow to edit. In a transition, choose Validator > Field Required Validator

h3. Expected results
When choosing a Field Required Validator to a transition, the name of the custom field should be written on more than one line, so the Available Fields box would not be stretched to the right.

h3. Actual result
The Custom Field name is written on one line, extending the Available Fields box to the right.

h3. Workaround
Make the name of the custom field shorter.
fields.summary: Custom fields with big names make the Field box stretched to the right on Field Required Validator

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When language is set to Dansk, an error message is displayed when attempting to comment on an issue, while setting a restriction for that comment. Although the error message suggests that the operation wouldn't be allowed, clicking on "Add" would actually allow the comment to go through successfully.

Note that this only occurs in the old issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set account language to Dansk
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 # Navigate to a Jira issue using the old view
 # When commenting on the issue, click on the "lock" icon, and select any roles or groups.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

We should see the confirmation that the comment is being restricted to the specific role or group.
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

An error message is displayed, which suggests that the selected role or group is invalid and it needs to be changed.

!image-2020-05-11-19-21-09-000.png|thumbnail!
{quote}Begrænset til <span classsecurity.level.unavailble=Det valgte sikkerhedsniveau er ikke tilgængeligt, du skal ændre det
{quote}
h3. Notes

This bug is only a visual bug. After selecting the role or group, you can simply "Add" the comment, and the comment will still be posted with the correct visibility.
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When [linking a Jira project to a Confluence space|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/enable-and-disable-pages/] in the *Pages* part, if the space has [an archived page|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Page-archiving-is-now-live-in-beta-on-Confluence-Cloud/ba-p/1360239], the following issue will be displayed when trying to access it:

{quote}
Well, this is awkward...
We can't show you these pages. Please try again later.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Jira project, go to the *Pages* option
# Tap the *Connect a space* button and select a Confluence space.
# In Confluence, go to a page in this space, which would be displayed in the list of pages for the project.
# In this page, tap the ellipsis button on the top right and select the *Archive* option to have the page archived.
# Go back to the Jira project and access the *Pages* option

h3. Expected Results
A list of pages linked in the space should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The following issue is displayed:
!issue.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Pages" results in an error if the linked space has an archived page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a workflow has a transition from Created status to Closed, if a post-function is set, trying to update the Resolution field, the ticket is moved but the Resolution field isn't updated. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Update the workflow so the Create transition will go directly to Closed.
# Set a post-function in this transition, to update the Resolution field.
# Create a ticket to use this transition

h3. Expected Results
The issue created will be moved to Done status and will update its Resolution field to the resolution set.
h3. Actual Results
The ticket is created and moved to the Done status but the Resolution field remains Unresolved. 
h3. Workaround
What we can accomplish is to create an *Automation Rule*, that when a ticket is created it will be transitioned to Done and sets its resolution to Done as well. Please, follow the next steps to accomplish it:
# Anywhere in your instance, *type the keyboard letter 'G' twice* -> *Automation rules* and Enter
# In the top-right corner, click on *Create rule* and you'll read some best practices and information regarding the Automation for Jira
# After going through the information, click in _Issue created_ to set as your *Trigger* and *Save*
# Select a *New action* -> *Transition issue* -> *Set destination status* -> *Choose a field to set* as well, _Resolution_ in your case -> *Select the resolution* then *Save*
# After creating your automation rule, it will be applied to all projects, *click in the Rule* and over *Scope* change from All projects -> *Single Project* and select which project you'd like to apply it to.
fields.summary: Post-function from Created to Done isn't updating Resolution field

fields.description:

 # Search for the page.

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

It rather prompts to set up an application link to the Confluence site.
 !PagesExist.png|thumbnail! 
 !SearchingForExistingPages.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Use the dropdown arrow to manually select the page to link to the issue.

OR

You may consider to paste the link of the Confluence page directly in the search bar and then click Link, which will link the page correctly.

This only applies to the group *Jira - administrator* currently, so far the delete button for *Jira-software users* still works.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Grant the permission *Create next-gen projects* to the group *Jira - administrator*
 # Once the change is applied, attempt to remove the group from that permission by clicking on the *Delete* button for the group.

h3. Expected Results

The *Delete* button leads the user to another page which confirms if they would like to remove the group from being granted the permission
h3. Actual Results

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the old email pipeline is in use, base64 images embedded in notification e-mails cannot be rendered:
{noformat}Unable to render embedded object: File (image/png;base64,<...>) not found.{noformat}
If “Email From” is other than "${fullname} (Jira)", it means tenant is not using the new Notification Platform as the Notification Platform system doesn’t know how to handle the custom "Email from" value. The value "${fullname} (Jira)" is the default one, It makes customer to use the new Notification Platform.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change "Email from" value to a custom one in Jira System General config
 # Attach a base64 image to an issue that has notification active

h3. Expected Results
In the notification e-mail the attached image is rendered correctly.

h3. Actual Results
Attached base64 image is not rendered in the notification e-mail.

The below error is vidible in the notification e-mail file:
{noformat}
Unable to render embedded object: File (image/png;base64,<data>) not found.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Change the "Email from" value back to its default so that Jira will use the new Notification Platform. Keep in mind that the email layout is different than the old one, and the Issue Event emails will be grouped in a 3-5 min window.
fields.summary: Embedded images in notification e-mails fail to be rendered

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a *Sprint Burndown Gadget* is added to a dashboard while the user in their profile a different language than Jira's default, all *Sprint Burndown Gadgets* will be rendered in that language.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into Jira as *User A*, which must have its language set to Jira's default.
# Create a new project with sample data, by navigating to *Projects > Create Project > Create sample data > Scrum software development*.
# Log off, then log in as *User B*.
# Create a new dashboard and share it with all logged-in users.
# Change language to French (or another language) by navigating to *Avatar Icon > Profile*.
# Add a new *Sprint Burndown Gadget* to the newly created dashboard. The gadget text should be displayed in French  (or another language) as expected.
# Log off, then log in as *User A*.
# Navigate to the dashboard created by *User B* in a previous step. Note how the gadget text is still displaying in French  (or another language).
# Create a new dashboard and share it with all logged-in users.
# Add a *Sprint Burndown Gadget* to the newly created dashboard. The gadget text will still be displayed in French  (or another language).

h3. Expected Results
* The gadget's text is displayed in the user's language.
* New gadgets added to dashboards are displayed in the user's language.

h3. Actual Results
* The gadget will be displayed in French (or other languages) for all users.
* New gadgets will be displayed in French  (or another language) despite that not being the user's language.


h3. Workaround

Edit the dashboard, remove the affected gadget, and re-add the gadget using the desired language as the user default language
fields.summary: Sprint Burndown Gadget is rendered in the language of the user who first loaded it

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When you look at an issue's details in the mac app, estimations such as "Time estimate" and "Original estimate" are shown using different measures.  For example, if the issue was estimated in the backlog to take 1 hour (1h), the Time estimate will show exactly that.  However the 'Original Estimate' will instead just show 3600 (presumably the number of seconds in an hour).  However because there is no units show here, it isn't always as clear what 3600 value is supposed to be.

h3. Suggested Solution
Standardize these units of times across both fields.  If these values need to all be in seconds, then let's clarify that 3600 is the number of seconds estimated.

h3. Why this is important
Consistency and clarity in understanding.

h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Estimations in the Mac app for Jira Cloud should be consistent in the units of time displayed to end users

fields.description:
User references, such as in filters, dashboards, boards, etc, should show the username if the user is under Organization control. It is essential for a Jira Admin to be able to see who a filter references or is owned by to manage the site. I understand the anonymity requirements, but those should not apply to a user that is controlled by an organization through the domain ownership. There is no expectation of privacy within a corporate domain. The current policy makes it very difficult for a Jira Admin to be able to update a filter or other user-related features.

As example, if I have a simple filter of "Assignee in (User1, User2, User3), it turns User1, User2, User3 into IDs instead of their names or email addresses. This makes it very difficult to maintain this filter if I want to remove User3. I either have to investigate which of the three IDs is User3 or remember the order. There is no need for this level of anonymity for an organization-controlled user.
fields.summary: Users under Organization Control should show Usernames, not IDs

fields.description:
As a Jira Administrator, I want to limit the fields that users are able to Bulk Update so that I can preserve data integrity of calculated, read-only, or other system-generated fields.

We have several system-generated fields that are "read-only" for users, and others that we don't want users to be able to modify once an issue reaches a certain state. Bulk Update allows users to bypass the controls we have implemented and edit any field value. We would like the ability to restrict the list of fields available in the Bulk Update operation.

(Similar to JRACLOUD-34281)
fields.summary: Ability to restrict field list in Bulk Update

fields.description:
When searching for parent issues with values greater than zero for the time spent field, the JQL should consider its child issues for that field as well.

Having a parent issue of issue type Task, for example, that doesn't have any value for the time spent field but has sub-tasks with a value greater than zero for that field, when using the expression "timespent > 0", should appear as a result for that JQL.

Example:
||Issue||Time Spent||
|Parent|0|
|Child #1|30m|
|Child #2|15m|

JQL: timespent > 0
Actual results: no issues
Expected results: Parent
fields.summary: The timespent field for a parent should consider including child values in JQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a cascading select list and using a post function to copy the value from the parent to a sub-task, errors are generated if the value in first list of the cascading field has no options in its second list.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *Select List (Cascading)* custom field
 # Populate the first list with at least two options
 # On the first option, have at least one sub-option
 # On the second option, have no sub-options
 # Create a post function on the create transition to copy the value of that field to its sub-task
 # Create an issue with the second option selected
 # Create a sub-task
 # Experience the issue
 # Change the parent task to the first option
 # Successfully create a sub-task

h3. Expected Results

A sub-task is created and the value(s) for the *Select List (Cascade)* are copied to the sub-task.
h3. Actual Results

The sub-task is created, but errors are shown when trying to create the sub-task and the sub-task is visibility in the parent task depends upon whether new issue view is used or old issue view.

In new issue view:
 * The sub-tasks are shown
 * An error upon sub-task creation is shown though:
{code:none}
We couldn't create the subtask
Check your connection, then give it another try
{code}

In the old issue view:
 * The sub-tasks are not shown
 * An error upon creation is shown (despite the sub-task) being created:
{code:none}
We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file.
{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Copying a cascading select list from parent to sub-task fails

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In Jira Software and Jira Core projects, the "Domain of Reporter" and "Domain of Assignee" (advanced custom fields) are only shown in the OLD ISSUE VIEW, not available in the new issue view, even though populated.
h3. Suggested Solution

This type of field should have its value shown also in the new issue view. This is how it looks like in the Old Issue View:

!image-2020-05-04-17-30-09-290.png|width=472,height=224!
h3. Why this is important?

How about a solution for those of us who would like to retrieve our data and use in our own web apps?
fields.summary: Allow cross-domain requests for CORS in web apps

fields.description:
_This is same as https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41181 That issue is closed as duplicate without giving link to duplicate issue._

Basically, JQL doesn't worry about the case for labels (mylabel == MYLABEL) but when creating an issue, the component does care about the sensitivity of the case (mylabel != MYLABEL) which is inconsistent behaviour.

To reproduce:

1. Create a new issue
 2. Give it label 'MYLABEL' all uppercase
 3. Create the issue
 4. Create another issue, and start typing 'MYL' to see that it suggests 'MYLABEL' as an existing label.
 5. Delete this text and start typing 'myl' in lowercase and see that it wants to create a new label.
 6. Don't create an issue and close the dialog.
 7. Go to issue navigator
 8. Type in JQL labels = 'mylabel'
 9. See that the issue with label 'MYLABEL' appears
fields.summary: Labels are not case sensitive in JQL but are case sensitive when creating a label

fields.description:
As a company that uses Jira Service Desk (JSD) for all customer service, we need to be in full control over as many parts of the UI as possible. We need all UI to be translatable and use the wording that matches the communication we choose to have with our customers. This is absolutely vital for companies that wants to be in charge of the customer journey using JSD.

Problem: Currently there are hardcoded parts of the landing page, and not only the landing page as elements are used on all pages.

The section "Learn more about". This refers to the categories used in the knowledge base. This should be possible to:
 # Rename
 # Translate
 # Remove

The footer "Need to raise a request? Contact us". This should be possible to:
 # Rename
 # Translate

I would love to visualize what I mean but have found no way to upload a screenshot unfortunatly.
fields.summary: Full control over knowledge base landing page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issues that contain child issues, when searching them through _Advanced search for issues_, selecting it then navigating to the child issue, the child issues' issue key changes to the parent issue key. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Jira Advanced search for issues
# Find an issue with one or more child issues
# Under _Issues in this Epic_ or _Subtasks_, select issue and get redirected to the issue page

h3. Expected Results
Expect to see the child issue key in the navigator

h3. Actual Results
Parent issue key is displayed and if you click in the issue key it redirects you to the parent issue shown as the issue key. 

h3. Workaround
If you do any updates in the issue, the issue key returns to the child issue key. If you change the browser URL you can see the issue key desired.
fields.summary: Browsing parent issues on issue navigator, child issues' issue key changes for the parent issue key when selected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If square brackets and a smart value (or more) are entered in the *From Name* field of the "send email" [automation action|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automation-actions/?_ga=2.194211758.280585632.1588067089-1080961822.1564054573] then the square brackets and the text among them will not appear in the friendly-from field of the received email
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # created a [Jira Automation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automate-your-jira-cloud-processes-and-workflows/?_ga=2.194211758.280585632.1588067089-1080961822.1564054573] rule that, on specific conditions (e.g. issue commented), uses the "send email" [automation action|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automation-actions/?_ga=2.194211758.280585632.1588067089-1080961822.1564054573] to send an email to your address
 # Set something like [JIRA] followed by some text in the *From Name* field.
 !From-Name.jpg|thumbnail! 
 # Trigger the rule and see that the received email will correctly show the text from above step
 !From-Name-received.jpg|thumbnail! 
 # Now set the *From Name* field to, for example: {noformat}
[JIRA] {{reporter.displayName}}
{noformat} !From-Name-smart-value.jpg|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

The received email will show [JIRA] followed by the name of the reporter of the issue that has been commented

h3. Actual Results

Only the reported name is displayed.  [JIRA] has totally been removed from the friendly-from:
 !From-Name-received-smart-values.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Putting the text in the *From Name* field among quotes seems to work fine and returns the same result of step #3 above:
{noformat}
"[JIRA] {{reporter.displayName}}"
{noformat}
 
 However, if the reporter has special characters in their name (for example: ä, ö, ü) then the double quotes are shown in the friendly from field of the received email.
fields.summary: Square brackets removed from friendly-from of received emails when using smart values in the send email automation action

fields.description:
h4. Problem definition

Currently, when using the basic search, it's not possible to distinguish between custom fields that were created for next-gen projects and the ones for classic projects. 

h4. Impact

When trying to use the basic search, if the custom fields have the same name, it's not possible to identify which ones are from the next-gen project (and which project), and the ones from the classic projects. This adds a level of difficulty on performing searches for specific projects or even to evaluate what custom fields are in use. 

h4. Suggested resolution

Add the possibility to distinguish classic and next-gen custom fields. Example: using a tag on the name.
fields.summary: Allow a way of identifying custom fields from classic and next-gen projects in the basic search

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Currently, we're unable to hide/archive a board from a current project while maintaining access to all of the data and the boards themselves but don't see them as part of our current Jira project.
h3. Why is it important?
It gives great advantage while organizing your project and its boards, facilitating the users' ability
h3. Suggested resolution
As a possible workaround, what we can accomplish is move the board from the current project to a new one, where only a specific group/user has the permission to *Browse Projects* in this new project. Therefore, the board will be unavailable and out of the current project but will keep its configuration.
fields.summary: Archive boards from current project

fields.description:
The layout of a Jira dashboard is defined by widgets, which have fixed sizes based on the data & limited configuration.


It would be nice to be able to arrange the widgets on rows to compare between them.
fields.summary: Ability to rearrange/resize widgets in rows

 # Create a rule that runs on an Epic event and has a branch for Stories (or other issues in Epic)
# Trigger the rule and it will return an error containing "Field 'parent' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it"

h3. Expected Results
Run is executed

h3. Actual Results
An error is logged related to parent field

h3. Workaround
Enable sub-tasks and delete any issue type with the type sub-task
fields.summary: Branch for Stories (or other issues in Epic) fails if sub-tasks are disabled (NextGen)

fields.description:
Current conditions
 * Users can vote if they found a customer review helpful or inappropriate
 * Users can see the resulting votes of the reviews
 * Marketplace vendors can respond to reviews, and there is not voting if users found the response as helpful or inappropriate

 

Suggested improvements
 * Add user voting for marketplace vendor responses to reviews, indicating helpfulness and inappropriate nature
 * Show the resulting votes on the responses 

 

What's in it for Atlassian and your customers:
 * Atlassian could more readily see how their marketplace vendors are responding to reviews, and the effectiveness of their responses
 * Customers and potential customers will be empowered to indicate their satisfaction level with marketplace vendors' service levels and respect of their customers
fields.summary: Add voting for marketplace vendor review responses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The REST API endpoints to get all users (below) are not returning the *emailAddress* field:
 * [Get all users default|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-users-get] (GET /rest/api/3/users)
 * [Get all users|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-users-search-get] (GET /rest/api/3/users/search)

 At the same time the [Get user|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-user-get] endpoint (GET /rest/api/3/user/search), to only get active users, returns the email address or not depending on the users' [Profile Visibility Settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2019/07/profile-visibility-settings-are-now-available-on-atlassian-cloud] (like the rest of the user related REST API endpoints).

Therefore, either we make this behavior consistent or we explicitly document this behavior and we motivate it. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Call the [Get user|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-user-get] endpoint like, for example:
{code:java}
https://<NAME>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user/search?query=&maxResults=1000 {code}
# See that, among the other things, the email address field is returned: 
{code:java}
...
"self": "https://<NAME>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user?accountId=XXXXXXXXXXXXX",
 "accountId": "XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX",
 "accountType": "atlassian",
 "emailAddress": "XXXXXXXXXX@atlassian.com",
...{code}
# Now call the [Get all users default|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-users-get], for example: 
{code:java}
https://<NAME>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/users{code}

h3. Expected Results

The behavior is consistent with the one of the  [Get user|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-user-get] endpoint.
h3. Actual Results

The *emailAddress* field is not returned at all:
{noformat}
    ...
    "self": "https://<NAME>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user?accountId=XXXXXXXXXXXXX",
    "accountId": "XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX",
    "accountType": "atlassian",
    "avatarUrls": {
...{noformat}

h3. Notes
This bug is affected by the email visibility setting on your instance:
- *Jira Settings* > *System* > *General Configuration* > *User email visibility*

If this is set to "Show to logged in users only" (which is the default), then this endpoint does not return the email addresses at all (that's a bug, visible email addresses should be returned)

However, if you change this setting to "public", then email addresses are returned, but if the person's email visibility is set to "public" then this would cause their email address to be returned even for anonymous requests, which may not be desirable.

h3. Workaround

If you want to get the list of all the users (active and inactive) for your instance, including the email address, you can use the *Export Users* button on the top left of the User Management page for your site:

 !Export-Users.jpg|thumbnail! 

This way you can configure what will be included and what not and you will get in return a CSV file including email address, account ID and other useful data that can be easily parsed. 

 !Export-Users2.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The REST API endpoints to get all users are not returning the email address field

fields.description:
Why am I allowed to close without warning after adding a tag?

If I add a label via typing it and pressing enter, it should automatically add the label. I should then be able to click Close and save.

Alternatively, if I add a label via typing it and press enter and did not click Add, clicking Close should warn me that I have unsaved labels.

Currently there is no public documentation explaining the scenario of Board not having a location set when the user, who had a board in his/her profile, is removed.

 # Create a board and add to user's profile. Copy the Board URL
 # Remove this user from the site. 
# Now as an admin access this board URL. It will ask for a new Board location.

It would be good if this scenario is documented in https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/change-the-location-of-a-board/ .
fields.summary: Document the scenario of Boards having no Location set after the user is removed.

fields.description:
Background:

We had Jira users working in our organization that used personal accounts to access our Jira because they were using other Jira's from other companies too.

We had domain verification in our Jira to validate who are our members and I think the domain verification was also related to some Bitbucket integration.

What started to happen was that the none company email users were considered as not part of the managed organization. And because of that, there were some avatar issues. 

So there is at least one and potentially other difficulties for users who are part of an organization in Jira who have domain verification.

The current workarounds were to create a new Jira account with the company domain which makes users part of the organization, but that is not a solution for people who use different Jiras.  Another workaround was specifically for avatars for organization members to make them public so that non-member with different emails can see it.



Suggestion:

Besides automatically managed members in a managed organization that is based on domain verification please add a way to manually add members as part of the organization. This is even useful when a company has multiple domains and it's really silyl requirement that all have emails from the same domain.

I created a support ticket where we looked into this issue and where I was left with workarounds and so I'm creating a suggestion in the hope this becomes a new feature someday. The support ticket was JST-565921 if it helps.
fields.summary: Domain verification enabled managed organization manual member management

fields.description:
I was hoping you could help with a solution for the dropdown selection used for picking a field to be used in a Jira dashboard widget. Currently there are over 1,000 fields to choose from in the dropdown, many with the exact same name, and they are not listed in any discernible order (such as alphabetical).
Here are my proposed solution options:
1. PREFERRED - Add a prefix to each field in the list then sort them alphabetically.
 * If the field is not a custom field it could be prefixed with "All Projects" (example if the field is called "Program" it would display "All Projects - Program").

 * If the field is a custom field the prefix would be the originating project (example if the field is called "Program" and it was created in the "VoltronPRJ" project it would display as "VoltronPRJ - Program").
2. If #1 is too complicated it would be helpful to at least have the entire list be sorted alphabetically. That way I can easily try each duplicate field, 1 by 1, until I get to the one I need.
Please let me know if you have any questions. Thanks!
fields.summary: Organize the fields in the dropdowns used in dashboard widgets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The gadget "Average time in status" is not providing the results as described in its description:
{quote}
Displays the average number of days issues have spent in status.
{quote}
When comparing the results with manual calculations there is a big difference in which I am not able to explain how this has resulted.

* Also, important to add that this gadget only consider issues that were resolved in the same period (whether you're using Hours or Days)

(On a side note, this gadget is also not listed in [this list|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/using-dashboard-gadgets-776636252.html] from our knowledge base).


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Choose 3 tickets that were in the same status for some time
# Resolve those 3 tickets
# Create an "Average time in status" that filters the tickets you resolved
# Verify the results within the gadget and compare with your own average calculation

Within my tests, I had the following values for time spent in the "To Do" status for each ticket, these were the only resolved tickets within that day on my filter:

* ABC-1 
{code}
12.08	total days  or,
289.84	total hours
{code}
* ABC-3
{code}
12.08	total days
289.95	total hours
{code}

* ABC-4
{code}
12.08	total days
289.85	total hours
{code}


h3. Expected Results
The gadget would do the following calculation:

Where:
T = time spent for that resolved ticket in the 'example' status
N = Number of tickets closed on the respective period
(T1 + T2 + T3...) / N

So for the above example using *days* as period we would expect *12.08 days* of average

h3. Actual Results
These are the results obtained from the Gadget:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Average time in status gadget calculation is incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to add new components (trigger OR conditions OR actions) to Automation rules, the user is redirected to Rule's details screen. If you try to click on the component just added, it shows an error, even if you have already saved the Rule's details configuration.

The problem happens when you try to create a new rule as also when you try to add a new component to an existing rule; editing an already existing component of an already existing rule seems to be working fine.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on "Create rule" button - by default, it should redirect you to the trigger configuration, but now it shows the rule's detail screen
 # Add a title to your rule and click on "Save and select trigger"
 # Choose a trigger - you'll be again redirected to the rule's details instead of trigger's configuration

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to add components no matter the rule's details. The rule's details (the required details) should be demanding to be set only after you've built the whole rule and try to save it.
h3. Actual Results

Not able to add and/or edit components:

!image-2020-04-29-11-21-43-182.png|width=398,height=274!

No errors seem to be shown in the DevTools, only warns. Source tab shows the following:

!image-2020-04-29-11-49-04-925.png|width=734,height=264!
h3. Workaround

Whenever the rule's detail screen appears, if you click on "Cancel", it's possible to add the new trigger component. However, once you save the component's configuration, the rule's details will appear again. Then, you'll have to click again on "Cancel" to add another component.

The video below is an example of how to use this workaround:

[https://share.getcloudapp.com/o0ugEOoj]
fields.summary: When trying to add new components to Automation rules, user is redirected to "Rule's details" configuration screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can configure the size limit of attachments in your Jira instance.

Currently, in the new view, if you try saving a comment with a file that's bigger than the limit you have configured, a misleading message will be displayed:
{noformat}
It might be empty or have invalid formatting. If you copy-pasted, try removing the formatting and adding it directly in the editor.
{noformat}

That doest not help the customers, which will likely need to contact the support in order to understand what is happening.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Set the size limit for attachments to 1 MB;
* Try saving a comment in the new view with a 1.4 MB attachment.

h3. Expected Results

An error message stating that the size of the file is not accepted will be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

A misleading error message is displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-29 at 10.42.13.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Misleading error message displayed in the new view when attachment is bigger than the limit configured

fields.description:
